The key data management expectation for projects funded under Horizon2020 and participating in the Open Research Data pilot is that you manage your data according to the FAIR principles and share all data needed to validate the results and conclusions presented in scientific publications so that third parties can access, mine, exploit and reproduce them, for more information see: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/funder, for more information on data sharing see: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/data-sharing

Your DMP now describes how you will manage data in your own research group at KU Leuven, the European Commission however expects a DMP to describe how you make/made data from all partners FAIR for other researchers outside of your consortium by depositing your data in a trusted data repository such as Zenodo (https://zenodo.org/) or RDR (https://rdr.kuleuven.be/) following the principle "as open as possible, as closed as necessary"

You can find guidance for each question of the DMP in www.dmponline.be and more information about the FAIR principles here: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/fair. Contact us via rdm@kuleuven.be if you like to meet to discuss how you can share your data and which repositories could be suitable for your work
